question: Which of the following is the name given to the group of small pieces of rock - revolving round the sun between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter?
explanation: The group of small pieces of rock - revolving round the sun between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter are called asteroids. The asteroid belt is the circumstellar disc in the Solar System located roughly between the orbits of the planets Mars and Jupiter. It is occupied by numerous irregularly shaped bodies called asteroids or minor planets.
